job_title: M D in Providence, RI
pros: An excellent health care facility
cons: i find it difficult to park

job_title: Nurse Practitioner in Providence, RI
pros: Small local hospital, friendly staff
cons: Paid too low for duties

job_title: Human Resources Assistant in Providence, RI
pros: Nice people, good benefits and hours
cons: Layoffs and leadership always changing

job_title: Information Technology in North Providence, RI
pros: Friendly employees, get to work with lots of technology. Good benefits, great food, plenty of parking.  I like that I get to work with the other departments.
cons: Company outsourced too many positions to India,  There is no loyalty to employees, Everyone is treated as replaceable and they let you know that.  Too Many people were promoted into Director and VP roles that are not qualified and manage by intimidating the staff.

review_title: Pay is fair, expectations were not
job_title: Access Center Specialist in Providence, RI
pros: Hourly rate was good, overtime was available from time to time. Health Benefits were good.
cons: Often our department would be held accountable to actions that the providers were responsible for. Upper management would add lots of additional job requirements with no additional compensation.

job_title: Registered Nurse in North Providence, RI
pros:
Incentive Pay (Currently $50/hr for hours additional to position requirements)
Overtime Availability
cons:
Staff levels unsafe, no changes 
Difficult to use PTO
Mandatory on call shifts

job_title: Family Nurse Practitioner in Warren, RI
pros: Some really great people and knowledgeable resources
cons: Pay seems to be less than typical for RI

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in North Providence, RI
pros: Excellent experience working with the company
cons: Great job working as a cna

review_title: Be ready for everything to break
job_title: Developer in North Providence, RI
pros: Okay pay and PTO was good (5-6 weeks)
cons: Nobody knows what is exactly going on. They will tell you that you need one more approval or it's waiting on one more person, but in actuality it's going nowhere

job_title: Vice President in Providence, RI
pros: Medical support staff and some nurses
cons: Horrible horrible leadership, poor HR resources, working environment such as unaddressed harassment issues

job_title: Buyer in Providence, RI
pros: Standard for the industry in healthcare
cons: No Bonus - as expected here

review_title: Don't expect training, support, or career development
job_title: Administrative in Providence, RI
pros: Generous vacation time, largely left alone to complete tasks, physical facilities are slowly being updated.
cons: Management is extremely self-serving and unresponsive. Requests for clarification or assistance are largely ignored. Zero interest in career development of existing staff, high turnover in upper management. Pay raises are paltry - you are unimportant, as an individual.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Providence, RI
pros: CharterCARE is new to the home care company I work for. So far, over the past year since their acquisition, I haven't noticed anything adverse in my position. Everything seems to be the same as it was prior to their arrival on the scene.
cons: In home care, RNs are required to do enormous amounts of documentation and still make visits. It isn't easy to manage and I do a lot of overtime. At first, it seems great but after a while it gets tedious and daunting. Especially now, one con is CharterCARE is for profit so we are required to see a certain amount of patients a day.

job_title: Human Resources Business Partner in Providence, RI
pros: Opportunities to grow  and assist in organizational excellence efforts.
cons: The holding company, which is based in CA,  decides how the organization will flourish in the community...the problem is these decisions are made without real knowledge of the communities in which they exist.

job_title: Information Tec in Providence, RI
pros: The company gives good flexibility with vacation time.  Employees throughout the company are friendly
cons: Micromanagement,  lack of respect from management, overworked.  Instead of replacing employees they keep bringing in unskilled contractors for more money who are not held to the same standards.   Management is not qualified for their positions.

review_title: Home Health - Great job to have if you like independent work!
job_title: Home Health RN in Providence, RI
pros: Good pay, decent support.
cons: Slightly outdated EHR. Outdated systems.

job_title: Receptionist in Providence, RI
pros: Very flexible and friendly work environment.
cons: Wish there were more money in the budget.

job_title: Telephone Operator in North Providence, RI
pros: working for chartercare was a awesome experience. I enjoyed working in a fast paced environment and being able to help in any which way I could.
cons: Was unable to use my sick time without getting written up

job_title: Nurse in Providence, RI
pros: Better than having no job
cons: Overwhelming sense that individual employees mean absolutely nothing. HR totally incompetent. Middle management petrified at not pleasing their bosses.

job_title: Executive Director in Providence, RI
pros: Absolutely none.   CCHP reputation makes it impossible to keep great applicants.
cons:
Incompetent Senior Management team.  
Greed....Global plan to turn profit at staff and patients expense. 
Positions consistently frozen or eliminated.
